introGame.title: What was the DART mission?
introGame.summary: The DART mission was NASA’s first planetary-defense experiment showing that a spacecraft could deflect an asteroid by crashing into it. It used the kinetic impactor technique—launching an object at high speed to change another body’s path without destroying it, like nudging a billiard ball in space. In this mini-game, you play that spacecraft: each shot is a precise impact that alters incoming meteors before they reach Earth. This concept can save our planet, because a small change in an asteroid’s direction—done early enough—can prevent a global catastrophe. So every time you fire, you’re not just playing: you’re reenacting the same principle that could protect humanity.

anticipate.title: Anticipate:
anticipate.body: shoot when the asteroid is still high.

position.title: Get underneath:
position.body: move just enough under its path.

priority.title: Prioritize danger:
priority.body: if it’s headed for the center, that’s first.

relax.title: Relax and enjoy:
relax.body: if you miss, restart and you’ll do better next time.
